docs.lead_paragraph: The Western White House Conference on Families ended quietly here yesterday with 613 delegates from 19 states and four territories endorsing proposals to establish community advisory councils at local schools, aid to the disabled and tax reform. Although the two-and-a-half day conference was marked by bitter debate over the proposed equal rights amendment, legalized abortion, and teen-age access to contraception, delegates to the third and last regional White House conference endorsed these proposals by substantial margins.

headline.main: AFTER HEATED DEBATES, FAMILY PARLEY ENDS QUIETLY

docs.snippet: The Western White House Conference on Families ended quietly here yesterday with 613 delegates from 19 states and four territories endorsing proposals to establish community advisory councils at local schools, aid to the disabled and  tax reform.    ...

docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, July 13--The Western White House Conference on Families ended quietly here yesterday with 613 delegates from 19 states and tour territories endorsing proposals to establish community advisory councils at local schools, aid to the disabled and tax reform.

headline.main: After Heated Debates, Family Parley Ends Quietly; Dissidents Walk Out For the Final Report

docs.abstract: conference ends; some of proposals discussed; executive director John L Carr comments; dissidents walk out, protesting lack of discussion on moral issues (S)
